intro: Apodanthera pringlei, commonly known as the Pringle's apodanthera, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. It has a low-growing habit with slender stems and narrow leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
